archeologyp1.adt

Class ToolBag

  • java.lang.Object
    • archeologyp1.adt.ToolBag

  • public class ToolBag
extends java.lang.Object
    TOOL BAG FOR THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL DIG TOOL
    Author:
    Daniel, Celine This class contains methods that allow the user to excavate the map depending on what tool they're using, and it also has methods that compute both the average and standard deviation.

    • Method Detail

      • magnetoMeter

        public void magnetoMeter(int row,
                java.lang.String col)
        For the public void magnetoMeter method
        Parameters:
        row -
        col - This method is for the magnetometer tool, which you use to sense charcoal types. If there is charcoal hidden in the coordinate you're checking with the tool, then the program sets the magnetometer for that square to equal true.

      • metalDetector

        public void metalDetector(int row,
                 java.lang.String col)
        For the public void metalDetector method
        Parameters:
        row -
        col - This method is for the metal detector, which (obviously) is there to sense metal over any coordinate the user asks to inspect. If there is a metal object or objects there that get inspected, then the program sets the metal detector equal to true.

      • visibleSpectrum

        public void visibleSpectrum(int row,
                   java.lang.String col)
        For the public void visibleSpectrum method
        Parameters:
        row -
        col - This method is for sensing any pottery in the coordinate the user specifies.

      • dig

        public void dig(int row,
       java.lang.String col)
        For the public void dig method
        Parameters:
        row -
        col - In this method, the user is able to find and excavate. If they excavate and there are items within the coordinate (based off the count size), then the boolean handling if the itemFound method will change to true.

      • computeAverageDate

        public double computeAverageDate()
        For the public double computeAverageDate method
        Returns:
        the average This method computes the average date from the specified dates. The nested for-loop computes the dates via what type the find is if an item in that coordinate has both been found and if there's also an object inside it, then add to the average date sum, and increment the itemCount. Finally, it will divide the average date sum by the itemCount total to get the real average date.

      • computeStandardDeviation

        public double computeStandardDeviation(double avg)
        For the public double computeStandardDeviation method
        Parameters:
        avg -
        Returns:
        the standard deviation This method computes the standard deviation first by going through and getting the variance based off the dates specified. It then takes the standard deviation from that, which is the square root of the variance.
